rev.diff:
Line 36: Line 36:
It was also conjectured that Bouazizi didn't have the funds to [[bribe]] the police officials to allow his street vending to continue.<ref>[http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0114/Sticking-a-fork-in-Tunisia-s-Ben-Ali Sticking a fork in Tunisia's Ben Ali]</ref> Salem and Samia Bouazizi accused authorities of trying to [[extort]] cash from their brother. <ref>[http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/bouazizi-has-become-a-tunisian-protest-symbol?pageCount=0 Bouazizi has become a Tunisian protest 'symbol']</ref> "What kind of repression do you imagine it takes for a young man to do this? A man who has to feed his family by buying goods on credit when they fine him ... and take his goods. In Sidi Bouzid, those with no connections and no money for bribes are humiliated and insulted and not allowed to live." said his sister Leila.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE70I7TV20110119 Peddler's martyrdom launched Tunisia's revolution]</ref>
It was also conjectured that Bouazizi didn't have the funds to [[bribe]] the police officials to allow his street vending to continue.<ref>[http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0114/Sticking-a-fork-in-Tunisia-s-Ben-Ali Sticking a fork in Tunisia's Ben Ali]</ref> Salem and Samia Bouazizi accused authorities of trying to [[extort]] cash from their brother. <ref>[http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/bouazizi-has-become-a-tunisian-protest-symbol?pageCount=0 Bouazizi has become a Tunisian protest 'symbol']</ref> "What kind of repression do you imagine it takes for a young man to do this? A man who has to feed his family by buying goods on credit when they fine him ... and take his goods. In Sidi Bouzid, those with no connections and no money for bribes are humiliated and insulted and not allowed to live." said his sister Leila.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE70I7TV20110119 Peddler's martyrdom launched Tunisia's revolution]</ref>
â
That day, Mohamed Bouazizi was publicly humiliated when a woman [[municipal]] official, Feyda Hamdi<ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/tunisia-i-have-lost-my-son-but-i-am-proud-of-what-he-did-2190331.html Tunisia: 'I have lost my son, but I am proud of what he did']</ref> or Fedya Hamdi<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201111684242518839.html The tragic life of a street vendor]</ref>, slapped him in the face, spat at him, confiscated his weighing [[scales]] and tossed aside his fruit and vegetable cart; all while her colleagues assisted her.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/bouazizi-ends-ben-alis-reign Bouazizi ends Ben Ali's reign]</ref> It was also stated that she made a slur against Bouazizi's deceased father.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE70I7TV20110119 Peddler's martyrdom launched Tunisia's revolution]</ref> "From that moment, he became angry," his cousin, Rochde Horchane, said.<ref>http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/tunisia-revolt-sparked-by-a-police-slap/story-e6frg6so-1225990556122 Tunisia revolt sparked by a police slap]</ref> According to Mohamed's mother, her son committed suicide because he had been humiliated and not because of their poverty.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201111684242518839.html The tragic life of a street vendor]</ref> "It got to him deep inside, it hurt his pride," she said, referring to the policeâs harassment.
+
That day, Mohamed Bouazizi was publicly humiliated when a woman [[municipal]] official, Feyda Hamdi<ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/tunisia-i-have-lost-my-son-but-i-am-proud-of-what-he-did-2190331.html Tunisia: 'I have lost my son, but I am proud of what he did']</ref> or Fedya Hamdi<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201111684242518839.html The tragic life of a street vendor]</ref>, slapped him in the face, spat at him, confiscated his weighing [[scales]] and tossed aside his fruit and vegetable cart; all while her colleagues assisted her.<ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/bouazizi-ends-ben-alis-reign Bouazizi ends Ben Ali's reign]</ref> It was also stated that she made a slur against Bouazizi's deceased father.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE70I7TV20110119 Peddler's martyrdom launched Tunisia's revolution]</ref> Her gender made his humiliation worse due to expectations in the Arab world.<ref>[http://www.habibtoumi.com/2010/12/31/man-at-the-centre-of-tunisia-unrest-recuperating-doctors-say/ Man at the centre of Tunisia unrest recuperating, doctors say]</ref><ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/africa/tunisia-i-have-lost-my-son-but-i-am-proud-of-what-he-did-2190331.html Tunisia: 'I have lost my son, but I am proud of what he did']</ref> "From that moment, he became angry," his cousin, Rochde Horchane, said.<ref>http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/tunisia-revolt-sparked-by-a-police-slap/story-e6frg6so-1225990556122 Tunisia revolt sparked by a police slap]</ref> According to Mohamed's mother, her son committed suicide because he had been humiliated and not because of their poverty.<ref>[http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201111684242518839.html The tragic life of a street vendor]</ref> "It got to him deep inside, it hurt his pride," she said, referring to the policeâs harassment.
Soon after the confrontation that day, Bouazizi went to the local Governor to complain<ref>[http://www.thestar.com/news/world/article/922279--suicide-protest-helped-topple-tunisian-regime Suicide protest helped topple Tunisian regime]</ref>, but the Governor would not see him or listen to him. "My cousin said, 'If you don't see me, I'll burn myself'," Mr Horchane said. After being rebuffed by the Governor, he left a message for his mother on his [[Facebook]] page asking her to forgive him after losing hope in everything:
Soon after the confrontation that day, Bouazizi went to the local Governor to complain<ref>[http://www.thestar.com/news/world/article/922279--suicide-protest-helped-topple-tunisian-regime Suicide protest helped topple Tunisian regime]</ref>, but the Governor would not see him or listen to him. "My cousin said, 'If you don't see me, I'll burn myself'," Mr Horchane said. After being rebuffed by the Governor, he left a message for his mother on his [[Facebook]] page asking her to forgive him after losing hope in everything:
